Summary This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, Golang and Kubernetes. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu. As a member of the Kubernetes product team, you will build the operators and addons; the former, offering complete lifecycle management of mission-critical components, and the latter, a zero-ops experience for seamlessly integrating projects into your Kubernetes. You will bring Kubernetes to a wide range of use cases across public, private, and hybrid clouds. The Canonical Kubernetes Software Engineer is a developer with a passion for providing the best Kubernetes experience for any use case. On the Kubernetes team, you will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source to bring functionality to our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers. What You'll Do 
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events 
Who You Are 
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have interest and experience with Kubernetes
You are a python programmer with interest or experience in golang 
Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. #stack

Empresa especializada en la inteligencia empresarial, productividad y soluciones de gestión empresarial, busca incorporar a su plantilla a un/una Desarrollador/a .NET. con experiencia trabajando en consultoría. Tareas 
Actitud resolutiva, abiertos a aprender y a enseñar a otros compañeros, con motivación. 
Participar en la ejecución de un buen trabajo en equipo. 
Dotes de comunicación clara y precisa. 
Capaz de tomar decisiones. 
Ser capaz de organizar y liderar reuniones con el cliente para la toma de requerimientos. 
Redacción de documentación funcional detallada y concreta. 
Elaboración de Diseño funcional y técnico del alcance de la solución acordado con los usuarios finales. 
Implementación y despliegue de soluciones Cloud.
Seguimiento y aseguramiento de calidad de los test de las piezas desarrolladas de forma directa o por el equipo. 
Resolución de incidencias de segundo nivel como apoyo en los contratos de soporte de clientes. 
Apoyo en elaboración de valoraciones técnicas de proyectos para propuestas comerciales. 
Investigación y/o identificación de nuevas tecnologías a recomendar en la incorporación de la estrategia de la Compañía. 
Requisitos 
Formación: Licenciado/Ingeniería informático o rama técnica 
Experiencia profesional: +5 años como programador y +2 años como consultor 
Conocimientos en: 
MS Dynamics CRM, JavaScript, JQuery, TypeScript
Azure Cloud Services y conocimiento de Azurefunctions.
SQL
VB.NET, C#, ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC, SOAP XML Services, WinForms, Css y HTML.
Nivel de inglés: intermedio 
Beneficios 
Contrato indefinido 
Horario flexible de lunes a jueves. Viernes y meses de julio y agosto, jornada intensiva. 
3 días de trabajo en remoto y 2 presenciales, si el candidato vive en Madrid.
100% en remoto, si el candidato viviese en otra comunidad autónoma. 
Tickets restaurant y/o seguro médico (a partir de 1 año de antigüedad en la empresa) (1.200€).
Buen ambiente de trabajo.
Proyectos con nuevas tecnologías (MudBlazor, Power BI, Servicios Cloud…).
Formación constante a cargo de la empresa y dentro de la jornada laboral (cursos, certificaciones de Microsoft…).
Salario: 40K

This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Lancé en 2021, Team.is est une start-up de recrutement spécialisée dans la chasse et le recrutement de profils IT, Digital, Ingénierie & Supply Chain. Team.is c'est avant tout une entreprise à taille humaine animée par la passion du recrutement ! Team.is possède l'expertise et l'énergie pour s'attaquer à n'importe quel défi. Mais nous ne sommes pas des robots du recrutement. Nous sommes des consultants qui vivent et respirent ce que nous faisons ! Nous sommes déterminés à réaliser le meilleur travail possible pour cultiver des relations durables avec nos candidats et nos clients. En postulant à cette offre, vous aurez l'opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise fondée en 2018 qui a créé une Intelligence Artificielle frugale unique qui génère automatiquement des modèles prédictifs et est très efficace sur les petites données. Leurs modèles sont interprétables, robustes, légers et intégrables. Ils développent des composants IA intégrables dans les produits de leurs clients et créent des plateformes d'analyse prédictive par métier, adaptées aux compétences de leurs utilisateurs : du no code au logiciel pour data scientists. En partenariat avec le DevOps et l'équipe Data Scientist, vous participerez au développement de leur backend architecturé en micro-services. 
 Implémenter/maintenir les services backend
 Contrôler l'application des meilleures pratiques et des modèles de conception utilisés
 Participer aux choix d'architecture de la plateforme
 Packaging et du déploiement des services avec Kubernetes
 Participer à l'amélioration des tâches et des fonctionnalités
 Mettre en oeuvre des outils de vérification de l'intégrité des données
 Conseiller sur les meilleures pratiques en matière de partage de données confidentielles et sensibles
 Communiquer les connaissances backend aux nouveaux arrivants 
Avantages Il en faut plus pour vous convaincre ? 
 Un environnement dynamique et créatif
 CDI - Contrat cadre
 Tickets restaurants
 BSPCE (levée de fonds en cours)
 Entrainement au baby-foot en libre accès et rien que pour vous !
 Travail à distance soit :
 En full remote avec 2-3 jours sur site par trimestre
 Ou à Sophia Antipolis avec 2-3 jours de télétravail par semaine 
Et vous ! - Minimum 2 ans d'expérience - Idéalement diplôme d'ingénieur ou master en informatique - Mais profils autodidactes acceptées avec valorisation de l'expérience Compétences techniques - Python - Kubernetes / Docker - Architecture microservices - Architecture Cloud - Git / Gitlab Autres Compétences - Vous êtes réactif et force de proposition - Vous aimez être à jour des technos et bonnes pratiques - Vous êtes à l'aise dans un environnement agile - Vous avez un bon niveau d'anglais

job_title: Softwareentwickler - DevOps / JavaScript / PHP / Webentwicklung / Remote (m/w/d)
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
 Als wachstumsstarkes Software Unternehmen sind wir spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung KI-gestützter Kommunikationslösungen in Form von kanalübergreifenden Chat- und Voicebots sowie Live Chat Anwendungen und daher konstant auf der Suche nach neuen talentierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Unsere Themenschwerpunkte sind breit gefächert und bieten auch für erfahrene Entwicklern genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung. Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Verstärkung für unser Jobangebot Softwareentwickler - DevOps / JavaScript / PHP / Webentwicklung / Remote (m/w/d).
 Klingt spannend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine aussagekräftige Bewerbung über unseren Partner Workwise.
 Intelligente Kommunikation mit künstlicher Intelligenz ist unsere Spezialität. Um mit innovativen Produkten auf dem internationalen Erfolgskurs zu bleiben, suchen wir ab sofort Verstärkung für unser internationales Entwicklungsteam.
 Was erwartet dich?
 Du arbeitest als ein Allroundtalent in einem hochqualifizierten Entwicklungsteam. Im Einzelnen erwarten dich folgende Aufgaben:
  Du realisierst leistungsfähige Chatbot-Anwendungen von der Konzeption bis zum Produktivstart.
Du optimierst die User Experience durch die Auswahl der richtigen Komponenten und Frameworks.
Du entwickelst eigene Anwendungen für unser Chatbot Analytics Dashboard.
 Was solltest du mitbringen?
  Du bist ein Teamplayer, neugierig und schlägst proaktiv neue technische Lösungen vor.
Als proaktiver Problemlöser (m/w/d) hinterlässt du Code und Prozesse in einem besseren Zustand, als du sie vorgefunden hast.
Du sprichst fließend Englisch; Deutsch ist ein „nice to have".
 UNSER STACK
  Infrastruktur: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, RabbitMQ, REST, GraphQL, AMQP, Kong
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Neo4j
Monitoring: EFK Stack (Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana
(DevOps) Tools: Gitlab, Gitlab CI, PyCharm, Swagger, Postman
Web Dev: Python, Javascript, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, d3.js, chartjs
Webframeworks: Laravel, Sanic, Vue.js, Flask
 Was bieten wir dir?
  Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, gemeinsam mit uns die nächsten großen Sprünge zu machen. Lass uns gemeinsam die Technologien der Zukunft gestalten. Du wächst mit uns und erhältst von Anfang an eigene Projekte.
Deine Aufgaben sind breit gefächert und bieten dir auch als erfahrener Entwickler (m/w/d) genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung.
Bei uns kannst du deine Arbeitszeiten auf Vertrauensbasis flexibel gestalten. Nach vorheriger Absprache kannst du auch dein Home-Office beziehen.
Attraktive Gehaltsmodelle sind eine Selbstverständlichkeit.
Dein Arbeitsplatz befindet sich in einem großzügig ausgestatteten Altbau. Dein eigener Desktop-PC und Laptop gehören zur Grundausstattung.
Du hast einen eigenen Parkplatz oder kannst die gute Anbindung an die öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel nutzen.
Ein gutes Arbeitsklima und guter Kaffee runden unser Angebot ab.
 Unser Jobangebot Softwareentwickler - DevOps / JavaScript / PHP / Webentwicklung / Remote (m/w/d) klingt vielversprechend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine Bewerbung über Workwise.
 Bei unserem Partner Workwise kann man sich in nur wenigen Minuten ohne Anschreiben für diesen Job bewerben und den Status der Bewerbung live verfolgen.

Your tasks 📌
Implementing various development, testing, automation tools, and IT infrastructure
Execute the installation, configuration and testing of required services according to specifications
Maintaining service performance and availability
Performance tuning of various services
Troubleshooting of service issues together with the Development Team
Accomplish organisation goals by accepting a shared duty schedule
Supporting the R&D team with the software and system requirements
Develop and maintain an in depth understanding of the application/system/database architecture and the general application functionality used to maintain data integrity.
Recommend solutions on system/database to meet the technical requirements
Perform access analysis and security checks
Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
 Your profile 👩🏼‍💻👨🏿‍💻
(middle or senior job)
Experience lvl: 3+ years in DevOps is obligatory
Good experience working with different Linux Distributions
Experience with Docker containers and the use of open-source frameworks for orchestration 
Experience with the following services: Apache, Nginx, Lighttpd, MySQL 
Proficient with git and git workflows
Experience with scripting languages
Experience with various virtualization technologies
Hands-on experience with CI/CD practices and tools: Jenkins, Gitlab, etc
Knowledge about provisioning: Chef, Ansible
Hands-on with AWS infrastructure using Terraform
Strong technical problem-solving skills
Ability and desire to learn new things
Good Communication skills
Good English skills (both verbal and written)
Kubernetes and OnApp experience is a big plus
 Why join ❤️
An exciting and challenging environment that promotes professional growth and career opportunities within our company
Grow your experience within large environments especially within core technology offerings.
Work in conjunction with various people around the world and do interesting projects
Be a cross functional, contributing member of our company
Team building activities, personal development programs, medical insurance, meal tickets, yearly bonus system, private pension, extra vacation days, protection for local currency depreciation
 Salary ranges 💶
Senior level: up to 3300 EUR net

Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.
 Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?
 Trust Wallet is the world’s most inclusive, chain-agnostic, self-custody wallet that serves tens of millions users globally. Trust Wallet provides a secure, seamless and intuitive gateway to the crypto and NFT ecosystems. Our users are able to send, receive, stake, mint and store across 4.5+ million cryptocurrencies on 66+ blockchains, including Ethereum, BSC, Polygon, Solana, Avalanche, etc. Our developer community of different projects relies on us to reach millions of their users, build their own wallets, and grow crypto adoption.
 If you’re excited about developing privacy-preserving solutions using zero-knowledge proofs or multi-party computation for decentralized applications and passionate about delivering meaningful solutions to millions of users, we’d like to hear from you.
 Responsibilities:
  Define the mid-long term cryptography roadmap for implementation of cryptographic primitives, systems, and products
Design and implementation of secure multiparty computation frameworks and/or zero-knowledge proof systems and cryptographic protocols
Apply, analyze, and implement advanced cryptographic protocols from current literature
Collaborate with leading crypto projects and cryptography experts to spearhead the latest advances in decentralized applications

  Expert knowledge of state-of-the art zero-knowledge cryptography (e.g. SNARKs, Bulletproofs) or multi-party computation protocols (e.g. FROST, DKLs)

About Inscribe  is a Series B company backed by $38M in venture capital from seasoned Silicon Valley investors like Threshold Ventures, Crosslink Capital, Uncork Capital, and Y Combinator, along with angel investors including Box co-founder Dylan Smith and Intercom co-founder Des Traynor. We’re on a mission to create a fair and efficient financial services ecosystem — one that grants more access to “thin file” customers (who have traditionally been left behind) while keeping fraudsters out. Companies that use Inscribe are able to grow faster, reduce fraud, and serve more customers with a better experience. It’s a lofty goal, but one that our team of kind, funny, and wildly talented people from across the globe are committed to. We put people first by fostering an environment that is inclusive of diverse backgrounds, encouraging a sustainable work-life balance, and ensuring our team members have the resources and support to grow. Plus, our work anniversary gifts can’t be beat: poems, portraits, and (yes, it’s true) custom crossword puzzles created in your honor. What about our company values? We’re glad you asked: 
We’re builders: We create things that move society forward and let our work speak for itself. 
We’re here to win: We know where we’re going, and nothing will stop us from getting there. 
We’re kind: We’re human. We crave to understand others and to be understood. 
We have fun: We believe joy unlocks curiosity, creativity, and connection. 
We work with some of the fastest-growing fintechs in the world, such as TripActions, Ramp, Bluevine, Shift, and more. While we’re a remote-first company, we have HQs in San Francisco and Dublin, Ireland. The Opportunity As a ML Engineer at Inscribe you’ll apply your technical knowledge to solve real customer problems. You’ll join the Fraud team working on our core fraud detection logic and building new technical solutions to uncover fraud. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, machine learning experts and other engineers. You will be responsible for creating new methods of detecting fraud and tuning models to stay one step ahead of the fraudsters. You will have the opportunity to see your solutions go from initial idea to production in a matter of days. Responsibilities 
Build new fraud detection systems
Collaborate with the team during the research and development process of new systems
Write well-designed, documented, and testable code
Monitor and evolve existing production models
Evaluate and act on customer feedback
Identify and execute on improvements to the teams MLOps capability
Consider security implications in the design and implementation of your software 
About You 
Have 3+ years professional experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role
Have experience with machine learning, computer vision, or statistics
Are naturally curious and willing to dig deeply into a problem to find a solution
Are thoughtful about code quality and software architecture
Are familiar with Python or similar programming languages
Have a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or another relevant field 
Nice to Have 
Experience with AWS SageMaker
Knowledge of the Fintech industry especially risk teams
Experience building ML Models for document analysis

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.

Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (18+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎

Do you have a weird thing for bugs? No, not insects – the computer ones 🖥

If so, you’re the one for us. We’re looking for a Junior Application Security Engineer to join our Information Security team.

But, it’s not that easy – remember, we Never Settle 💪

You’ll need to be able to show your passion with bug bounty findings, community talks, certifications, and blog posts on your interest.

If this is ‘so you’, you know where to find us… 👀

What You’ll Be Doing
Providing knowledge, experience and support across all our security teams, and wider Technology and Business teams, as well as associated initiatives
Performing source code reviews across Revolut’s projects
Performing web and mobile app security testing
Managing and reviewing external testing and bug bounty programs
Innovating & building tools and solutions to add to our arsenal of security monitoring and testing procedures
Getting involved in the Software Development Life Cycle, embedding security architecture principles and efficient risk-based change review processes to support our product releases
Thinking of and implementing new ways to automate and improve security across our business

What You'll Need
1+ year of experience in the information security field
Experience performing security testing (code review and web/mobile application security testing)
Experience with Java, Swift, Python, Scala
An understanding of the technology stack
An ability to automate and script your work (Python, bash scripts)
A love for solving problems
SAST/DAST skills
The ability to explain complex things in an easy way
An eye for details
Experience developing security tools
To be familiar with automations
An understanding of DevSecOps

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Who is Forcepoint?
 Forcepoint simplifies security for global businesses and governments. Forcepoint’s all-in-one, truly cloud-native platform makes it easy to adopt Zero Trust and prevent the theft or loss of sensitive data and intellectual property no matter where people are working. 20+ years in business. 2.7k employees. 150 countries. 11k+ customers. 300+ patents. If our mission excites you, you’re in the right place; we want you to bring your own energy to help us create a safer world. All we’re missing is you!
 About The Role
 Forcepoint has a fantastic opportunity to join our team in Poland. This is a pre-sales engineering position where you will be working extremely closely with sales. You will be aligned with a sales rep and carry a joint quota. You are expected to work as team to create and execute a territory / account plan. This includes building relationships with partners and ensuring they can position and implement our solutions.
 From a technology perspective we are looking for someone with a Web, DLP and NGFW security background, with experience on positioning security products on large customers. You will be joining a great, successful team of SEs who will be happy to bring you up to speed. While we are responsible and accountable for our patch – we support and help each other, and only good team players will succeed.
 Like the industry and our customers, we are transitioning from network and data security products to a “Data-First” SASE architecture. Not all companies are moving at the same speed and many continue with our really good NGFW, DLP, Web Security and other products. You should feel at home in both worlds.
  What you will be doing:
  Lead discussions with customers to drive understanding and documentation of the customer’s environment and needs, specifically their cross domain, network security, DLP/Intellectual property protection needs and recommend appropriate products/services that meet these needs.
Deliver product, technology and/or customized solution presentations to technical and business decision makers which may include system demonstrations, white-boarding and technical Q&A sessions to the client. 
Provide pre-sales technical support, security engineering and technical guidance for the development and implementation of Forcepoint cybersecurity technologies for customer.
Work with customer, strategic partners, resellers and Forcepoint team members to architect, design, build, and deploy cyber security solutions for customers and partners in support of pilot and proof of concept demonstrations.
Attend industry conferences, trade shows and sales events and participate in related activities. 
Prepare, write, and present trade studies, cost benefit analyses, white papers, reports and briefings as required. 
Work with account managers and proposal team to develop technical content and diagrams for RFI/RFP responses
Orchestrate Product Specialists involvement during pre-sales activities
Collaborate with partners and professional services to design projects activities in order to have them aligned with customer expectations
Assist with maintaining state of the art demonstration and lab capabilities and other duties and projects as assigned.
  What you can bring:
  BS Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security or equivalent degree or equivalent experience
A minimum of 6 years demonstrated experience in cyber security field to include practices/methodologies, associated technologies, application design, and/or experience in an operational environment
3 years of pre-sales experience working directly with cyber security and/or network products in a team environment
Ability to effectively communicate with a broad range of audiences; from deeply technical to high executive C-level decision makers (sometimes in the same audience).
Must be able to collaboratively coordinate across traditional engineering disciplines, management and customers
Knowledge of networking topology, TCP/IP protocol, IP Forwarding, Network architectures, and components (firewalls, routers, etc.)
Linux/Windows systems administration experience preferred
Relevant industry certification programs (e.g. CISSP [and specializations], Certified Ethical Hacker, Carnegie Mellon Insider Threat Program Manager, Insider Threat Vulnerability Assessor, Insider Threat Program Evaluator, etc.) desired, but not required
Experience with cyber security engineering projects and programs
Pre-sales experience working directly with cyber security and/or network products in a team environment. 
Experience with Web security
Experience with Data Loss Prevention projects, approach and logics
Ideally have experience working with enterprise accounts
Confident communicator, able to proactively engage with customer.
Strong understanding of customers and prospects requirements, security design and system architectures

We are distributed team of 40 people working from 15 countries (North America, Europe, Middle East, Africa)
Team with decades of experience building databases and deep knowledge of Postgres internals

Looking to make an impact? Work on a team that emphasises collaboration and innovation? At SailPoint, we believe our success is directly tied to our corporate culture. Our Core Values, affectionately also known as the “Four I’s”: Innovation, Integrity, Impact, and Individuals inform the work we do here at SailPoint. and because they are independent of scale, they have served us well from our early days as a start-up through today as the fastest-growing, independent identity and access management (IAM) provider. 
Why SailPoint? 
Love what you do. And love where you do it. 
Smart people, fun culture, innovative work, collaborative on-site and remote environments — oh, and everyone’s really nice. That’s what people say about SailPoint. We’re known as the company where everyone wants to work. 
If you’re passionate about outsmarting cybercriminals and working at a company where you can truly have an impact, we want you to join us in either Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands remotely. 
SailPoint empowers the largest, most complex organisations by putting identity at the Centre of Security and IT.  Our 2,000+ customers including global financial institutions, government entities, pharmaceutical organizations, and retail organizations and more. 
What you’ll Do: 
The Implementation Engineer (part of Professional Services) plays a vital role in the successful setup, integration, and deployment of SailPoint’s SaaS (Identity Now) service offerings. This role will be working in our German market, requiring proficiency in both English and German. Implementation Engineers begin their journey at SailPoint with product training where they can leverage their professional experience to gain a deep understanding of our SaaS (Identity Now) solution. Within a month or two, they begin serving as technical engineers on customer projects. In these projects, they will employ their industry knowledge, technical and communication skills to implement organisational best practices for SailPoint products and identity governance. Within six months, Implementation Engineers will have established themselves as technically proficient and reliable team members within Professional Services, able to handle large, complex projects under the guidance of a Solution Architect. By the end of their first year, they will have become a trusted resource capable of providing world-class service with minimal supervision. 
Responsibilities: 
Working with customers on the installation, integration, and deployment of SailPoint SaaS products. 
Configuring SailPoint product as defined by Solution Architect. 
Communicating to clients and partners aspects of both the product and the implementation at the technical and/or functional level. 
Delivering technical training designed to enable/educate SailPoint customers and implementation partners. 
Requirements: 
3-5 years of professional work experience as part of a software company or systems integrator. This should include 2+ years of SaaS implementation experience 
Excellent communication skills (German and English) and experience working with clients and partners. 
Experience with some or all the following: 
Angular JS, Java, Bean Shell/JavaScript, JSP/Servlets, SQL. 
Web technologies: XML, SPML, SOAP, REST, Web / Application Servers, HTML. 
Setting up and installing software on both Windows and Unix 
RDMS Database Knowledge: Oracle, Sybase, MSSQL, MySQL. 
Experience with enterprise directories such as Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP. 
Networking principles: SSL/TLS/HTTPS, Certificate Management, Basic TCP/IP troubleshooting. 
Familiarity with cloud technologies: AWS, Azure, GCP. 
Preferred: 
SailPoint or other identity governance vendors such as Microsoft, Sun, Oracle, IBM, or Novell a plus 
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts a plus 
Familiarity with role-based access controls and least-privileged access models a plus 
Experience with project management duties (project planning, resource management, scope, schedule and status, documentation) 
Experience with quality assurance duties is a plus (usability testing, performance testing, automated testing, test scripts, test cases and test plans) 
Security software or IT audit experience 
Other languages such as French, Spanish or Italian are desirable but not essential 
Education: 
Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. J2EE certification is a plus. CISSP certification is a plus. 
Location: 
Germany, Poland, Switzerland, or the Netherlands 
Travel: 
This position requires up to 15% travel,

Full-Service-Leasing, modernes Fuhrparkmanagement und mehr – dafür stehen unsere Spezialist:innen bei Arval Deutschland. Mit ausgeprägter Kompetenz beraten sie Kunden:in bei Verwaltungsaufgaben, optimieren Prozesse und unterstützen bei der Vorbeugung finanzieller Risiken. Als Teil der internationalen BNP Paribas Gruppe gestalten unsere Mitarbeiter:innen für ihre Kunden:in alle Aspekte der Mobilität für eine Welt im Wandel. 
Sie haben Spaß am Pricing unserer Leasingrückläufer sowie am Management unserer Online-Auktionen? Die Betreuung und der 
kontinuierliche Ausbau von Datenbanken sind Ihre Passion? 
Dann bringen Sie die besten Voraussetzungen für die ausgeschriebene Stelle in einem dynamischen Umfeld mit. 
Verantwortungen, die Sie übernehmen: 
Sie ermitteln die Preise der Leasingrückläufer für unsere verschiedenen Verkaufskanäle
Die Mitgestaltung der Online Auktionen gehört zu Ihrem Arbeitsalltag
Sie kümmern Sich um die Ermittlung der Vorfälligkeitsentschädigungen
Die kontinuierliche Überwachung und Steuerung des Verkaufsbestandes gehört ebenfalls zu Ihrer Verantwortung
Sie betreuen die aktuelle Datenlandschaft und helfen aktiv dabei, diese weiter auszubauen
Die Analyse großer Datenmengen aus unseren Verkaufstätigkeiten und das Ableiten von vertrieblichen Handlungsempfehlungen bereichern Ihr Aufgabengebiet
Auch die Durchführung von Analysen bzgl. Markttrends im Bereich Gebrauchtwagenmärkte zählt zum Aufgabenpportfolio
Die Arbeit an internen sowie externen Remarketing-Projekten rundet Ihren Aufgabenbereich ab. 
Fähigkeiten, mit denen Sie überzeugen: 
Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes wirtschaftswissenschaftliches oder ähnliches Studium, oder über eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene vergleichbare kaufmännische bzw. technische Ausbildung
Sie zeigen Begeisterung für das Thema Online-Auktionen
Eine selbstständige Arbeitsweise, hohes Engagement, sowie Leidenschaft für Zahlen stehen bei Ihnen auf der Tagesordnung
Erste Erfahrungen im Bereich von Datenbanken sowie in Programmiersprachen wie SQL, SAS, VBA haben Sie bereits gesammelt
Sie haben Spaß an Pricing und Datenbankentwicklungen, insbesondere in der Anwendung auf Fahrzeugmärkten
Sie sind offen für ein breites und vielseitiges Aufgabenspektrum
Fließende Deutschkenntnisse und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse helfen Ihnen in Ihrem Arbeitsalltag
Zuverlässigkeit, analytisches Denkvermögen und Teamgeist runden Ihr Profil ab. 
Darauf dürfen Sie sich freuen: 
Eine umfassende Einarbeitung in die Themenbereiche
Tolle Kolleg:innen in einem internationalen Umfeld
Eigenverantwortliches mobiles Arbeiten
Interessante und zukunftsrelevante Aufgaben
Eine offene und wertschätzende Kommunikationskultur. 
Dynamische Perspektiven im stabilem Umfeld 
Die BNP Paribas Gruppe in Deutschland bietet ein einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld: Unsere 12 Gesellschaften bilden eine lernende Organisation, in der unsere Mitarbeiter:innen ihr Wissen miteinander teilen und von einem großen Erfahrungsschatz profitieren. Als Global Leader eröffnen wir ihnen spannende internationale Perspektiven, und in unserer von Agilität und Offenheit geprägten Unternehmenskultur bringen unsere Teams eine Welt im Wandel mit ihren eigenen Ideen voran.

job_title: Frontend Developer - Testing / User Interface / HTML / CSS / Remote (m/f/d)
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
 Als wachstumsstarkes Software Unternehmen sind wir spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung KI-gestützter Kommunikationslösungen in Form von kanalübergreifenden Chat- und Voicebots sowie Live Chat Anwendungen und daher konstant auf der Suche nach neuen talentierten Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Unsere Themenschwerpunkte sind breit gefächert und bieten auch für erfahrene Entwicklern genügend Herausforderungen und Abwechslung. We are looking for reinforcement at the earliest possible date Frontend Developer - Testing / User Interface / HTML / CSS / Remote (m/f/d).
 Sounds interesting? Then we look forward to receiving your application via our partner Workwise.
 Smart communication with artificial intelligence is our specialty. To remain on the road of international success with innovative products we are looking for reinforcements of our international development team as now of.
 Your tasks
  You will take full ownership and produce a clean, readable, and well-tested front-end code.
You have an eye on the look and feel of our UI and will participate in planning meetings with our UX team to create the future of our virtual assistants.
You will also build up automated cross-browser testing procedures.
You will implement and improve our front-end development pipeline to increase productivity and automating time-consuming build-jobs.
You support our code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
 Your profile
  You have a solid understanding of JavaScript (ES6/7), HTML, and CSS.
Experience with React, Vue.js, or similar frameworks.
You have “a feeling for good design” – padding and margin are not just CSS properties for you, and you love to create pixel-perfect user interfaces.
You are familiar with the Node.js ecosystem.
You know how to use modern development tools, such as JIRA, Confluence, Git, Gitlab, Docker.
You have experience with testing frameworks and libraries such as Jest or Cypress.
You are familiar with real-time communication protocols such as WebSocket or WebRTC.
Experience in debugging client-side browser applications.
 NICE TO HAVE
  You are familiar with code bundling and optimization by using e.g. Webpack, Eslint & Eslint
Familiarity with CSS preprocessors such as SCSS, SASS, or LESS.
Collaboration with other team members in our agile development environment.
 OUR STACK
  Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, RabbitMQ, REST, GraphQL, AMQP, Kong
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Neo4j
Monitoring: EFK Stack (Elasticsearch, Fluentd, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana
(DevOps) Tools: Gitlab, Gitlab CI, PyCharm, Swagger, Postman
WebDev: Python, Javascript, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, d3.js, chartjs
Webframeworks: Laravel, Sanic, Vue.js, Flask
 We offer
  You get the opportunity to take the next big leaps together with us. Let’s shape together technologies of the future. You will grow with us and receive your own projects right from your start.
Your tasks are broadly diversified and offer you enough challenges and variety even as an experienced developer.
At our company, you can arrange your working hours flexibly on a basis of trust. You can also move into your home office by prior arrangement.
Attractive salary models are a matter of course.
Your workplace is located in a generously equipped old building. Your own Desktop-PC and laptop are part of the basic equipment.
You will have your own parking space or can use our good public transport connections.
A good working atmosphere and good coffee complete our offer.
 Our job offer Frontend Developer - Testing / User Interface / HTML / CSS / Remote (m/f/d) sounds interesting? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application via Workwise.
 With our partner Workwise, you can apply for this job in just a few minutes without a cover letter and track the status of your application live.

Summary This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, Golang and Kubernetes. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu. As a member of the Kubernetes product team, you will build the operators and addons; the former, offering complete lifecycle management of mission-critical components, and the latter, a zero-ops experience for seamlessly integrating projects into your Kubernetes. You will bring Kubernetes to a wide range of use cases across public, private, and hybrid clouds. The Canonical Kubernetes Software Engineer is a developer with a passion for providing the best Kubernetes experience for any use case. On the Kubernetes team, you will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source to bring functionality to our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers. What You'll Do 
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events 
Who You Are 
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have interest and experience with Kubernetes
You are a python programmer with interest or experience in golang

job_title: Data Science Abschlussarbeit: Time Series Forecasting
description:
Wir bei anacision lieben und leben Daten! Wir glauben fest daran, dass künstliche Intelligenz uns dabei hilft, die immer komplexer werdenden Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu meistern. Hierbei unterstützen wir unseren Kunden mit unserer KI-Software anacision PLANNING und in KI-Beratungsprojekten.
 Energieeffizienz in der Fertigung ist wichtiger denn je. anacision behandelt dieses Thema auf eine vielfältige Art und Weise, u.a. im öffentlich geförderten Forschungsprojekt „ETA im Bestand“. In unserem Arbeitspaket behandeln wir das Pausen- und Kaltstartverhalten von zerspanenden Werkzeugmaschinen. Die Prozessqualität der spanenden Bearbeitung ist abhängig von der Genauigkeit der relativen Position zwischen Werkzeug und Werkstück, wobei thermische Einflüsse zur Verlagerung der Maschinengeometrie führen. Bestehende thermische Kompensationsmethoden führen zu erhöhtem Energiebedarf oder einer verschlechterten Prozessqualität.
 Diese thermische Verlagerung gilt es zu Modellieren, basierend auf verschiedenen Temperatur- und Motorsignalen, um eine Kompensation durch die Maschinensteuerung zu ermöglichen und letztendlich den Energiebedarf der Werkzeugmaschine nachhaltig zu reduzieren.
 Das erwartet dich 
Übernimm Implementierungsaufgaben und unterstütze uns bei der Konzeption einer produkttauglichen Lösung
Recherchiere zu Zeitreihenanalysen und deren Anwendung im Kontext von Temperatur- und Strommessdaten
Erprobe Transferlearning-Ansätze, um Kompensationsmodelle auf verschiedene Randbedingungen und Maschinen unterschiedlicher Baugröße zu übertragen
Tausche dich mit unseren Domänenexperten und Konsortialpartnern zur operativen Nutzung der Lösung an der Maschine aus und erhalte direktes Feedback zu deinem Ansatz
 Das passt zu uns  
Studium im MINT-Bereich oder in einem vergleichbaren Studiengang
Erste Erfahrung mit Programmierung in Python 
Erste Erfahrung mit Data Science und Machine Learning
Kreativität sowie Spaß an der selbständigen Entwicklung und Umsetzung innovativer Ideen
  Das bieten wir dir  
Übernimm Verantwortung vom ersten Tag an. Arbeite selbstständig an deinen Forschungsfragen mit Unterstützung durch erfahrene Data Scientists mit Forschungshintergrund
Hohe Relevanz: Energieeffizienz ist ein hoch aktuelles Thema. Überzeugende Ergebnisse haben das Potential als Standardprodukt bei Werkzeugmaschinen bei unseren Partnern verwendet zu werden
Profitiere von unserer Start-up- Atmosphäre: Wir haben eine moderne Fehlerkultur, fördern kontinuierliches Lernen und setzten auf motivierte Mitarbeitende
Nutze die flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Arbeitsorte für deine Study-Life-Balance
Sammle Erfahrung in einem agilen Team mit jahrelanger Projekterfahrung aus dem industriellen Umfeld
Stelle die Weichen für deinen Start ins Berufsleben

Senior Software Engineer - Container Images & Community Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation. In this role, you'll be developing the tools, technology and community processes necessary for building this new generation of container images. You'll be working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure we deliver container images with the highest quality whilst maintaining a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based devops. You will be contributing to a fast-moving product, and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this new team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and participate in exciting and exploratory tasks, where your feedback will be critical for the decision-making process. As a senior engineer, you'll be expected to have a solid software development background, allowing you to be leading junior team members, facilitating their onboarding into the team while acting as a subject-matter expert. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community! What you'll do 
Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
Work on automated Ci/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
Work in Python to deliver new functionalities to our container building tools
Demonstrate sound engineering principles by contributing directly to your team's goals
Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
Engage with the open source community as a subject-matter expert
Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
Help design new tools and products
Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributted environment
Mentor and help hiring
Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events 
Who you are 
You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
You have experience in collaborative development
You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
You have a track record of delivering timely, high quality software
You have experience with container images and containerised operations
You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud (e.g. Microsoft Azure, GCP, AWS, etc.)
You have significant experience with Python
You are experienced with Linux systems administration and package management
You are familiar with Golang
You have strong written and verbal communication skills to convey technical concepts
You bring clarity to technical and engineering discussions
You are someone who strongly believes that sharing is caring, and knowledge is power
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree 
What Canonical Offers: 
Learning and development, with annual budget for professional development
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority Pass for travel
Work remotely with a talented, distributed global team 
Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. #stack

S2S S.r.l. è un'azienda IT (di prodotto e sviluppo interni) nata nel 2005 e specializzata nella consulenza e nello sviluppo di soluzioni applicative anche in ambito IOT ed AI, con sede in Roma, ma che ha esteso la sua attività a tutto il territorio nazionale, aprendo nuove opportunità a professionisti di tutta Italia che vogliano far parte di un contesto giovane, in crescita, che offre formazione, tecnologie all'avanguardia, e soprattutto che rivolge particolare attenzione al benessere delle Persone e lo mette in pratica in diversi modi. Cosa facciamo per distinguerci?  Sviluppiamo con continuità il benessere in azienda e la relazione positiva con le nostre persone;  pensiamo che le persone si debbano divertire lavorando;  vogliamo che le persone abbiano modo di crescere professionalmente, attraverso i progetti e la formazione strutturata. 
 Contratto di assunzione (CCNL Commercio);

buoni pasto giornalieri
assicurazione sanitaria

 Formazione continua su tecnologie specifiche, con seminari in sede e presso Centri Specializzati.

Lavoriamo full remote o ibrido da tutta Italia! A questo punto potremmo aggiungere la lista di almeno 30 tecnologie, DB, framework, linguaggi, etc. etc. Ma sicuramente salteremmo qualcosa, magari proprio uno dei pezzi forti delle tue conoscenze. A noi interessa di più che tu condivida il concetto che puoi imparare, anche rapidamente, una nuova tecnologia perché hai metodo nell’apprendimento. E noi ti aiuteremo a farlo. Se abbiamo sollecitato il tuo interesse, aspettiamo il tuo CV. Speriamo di conoscerti! Un’ultima cosa: la nostra azienda non è composta da risorse ma da Persone
